title: JoyMarsha
author: JoyMarsha
content: In 2021 I joined this forum as a graduate, having a small-paying job. This forum has exposed me to the fundamentals of Bitcoin and cryptocurrency, and how to enhance economic productivity in my daily life.This forum is Satoshi Nakamoto’s second great invention: a well-thought idea that was initiated to enhance our crypto knowledge. We had youth week in our church last week and we were asked to share ideas and knowledge. I tend to use the opportunity to lecture them about crypto, but last week I talked about the Bitcoin Forum, and how it is similar to our church group. There, we created a platform that will foster training in crypto, empowerment, mentorship, growth and networking for young people to collaborate on ideas. Like the forum, this will help get everyone achieve financial independence and the knowledge of crypto within and beyond our immediate environment.The desire to help these young people navigate through a career path in the crypto sphere through this forum is my vision to accomplish. I want my friends and well-wishers to know about crypto. That's why I came up with the plan to introduce and tell the youths about crypto, the forum and the rules and regulations governing it.Getting positive results of how eager they are willing to join and attain knowledge in crypto wasn't that easy because I started with the basics of crypto to lecture them, the forum ranks, merits, how to post and promote bounties, and the rules and regulations and so on. It is intimidating for many.However, I am happy about how far I have gone with them on the platform, and we are very grateful to God that the awareness may turn into a successful mission.We hope by the end of it, the exposure to crypto and the Bitcoin forum will be magnificent. That many will find a career path in this field, as it presents a rare but available opportunity to advance into financial well-being.

comments.author: taufik123
comments.body: Quote from: JoyMarsha on August 16, 2022, 03:10:36 PM-snip-Getting positive results of how eager they are willing to join and attain knowledge in crypto wasn't that easy because I started with the basics of crypto to lecture them, the forum ranks, merits, how to post and promote bounties, and the rules and regulations and so on. It is intimidating for many.-snip-The hard part is taking young people who don't know anything about crypto and then providing understanding until they are interested and join. You really have to explain the basics of cryptocurrency knowledge, because they must have a foundation on how crypto works, what crypto is and how its history is, all of which must be mastered.and in the next lecture, you only need to provide some additional material about this forum and what its advantages and disadvantages are. Do not describe this forum as a place to make money, because if the initial description is like that, they are beginners only focusing on how to make money on the forum rather than learning how to be a good member and can contribute a lot to the forum.Just look at how the newbie ranks on the forum, they disappear one by one and those who survive will certainly become qualified candidates.this is a tough task for you, but I'm sure you will get positive value from what you do. it's not only in your interest, but more in the common interest to make everyone aware of cryptocurrency, bitcoin and its technology, and about this forum. Good job and do your best.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: Good initiative. I don't have this kind of opportunity to lecture about cryptocurrency in my country since it's prohibited to use here. But I had tried to introduce this forum to my nearest persons. But sadly they don't spend time here nor much interest. Everyone just looks for money which is impossible from here for a beginner. This forum isn't for earning purposes, here we can learn. Anyway good to see you have chances to share about the forum and cryptocurrency publicly. The next generation should know about cryptocurrency very well.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: JoyMarsha on August 16, 2022, 03:10:36 PM I want my friends and well-wishers to know about crypto. It is a good thing you have in mind, but I must also remind and advice you to be careful and cautious as you introduce cryptocurrency to your friends. Cautious in the sense that as you talk about crypto and have highlighted its potential to affect ones financial situation positively, many of them may be eager to want to skip to the part where you tell them how exactly to gain and may urge you to give them some financial advice, however tempting, you must avoid that urge to give financial advice to them as you talk about crypto, so tomorrow if it doesn't go their way, they wouldn't have you to blame and your relationship will be save.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Quote from: JoyMarsha on August 16, 2022, 03:10:36 PMThat's why I came up with the plan to introduce and tell the youths about crypto, the forum and the rules and regulations governing it.I am happy  to have read this particular paragraph about your aims and adjectives.First, if you introduce them into the forum without telling them the necessary rules and regulations, within a few week, majority of them would be banned from the forum. The few that will escape ban might find it difficult to excel in the forum and eventually leave. So, it is important to educate them about the forum.Secondly, enlighten them about Bitcoin and neutralize the mindset of get rich quick scheme, then teach them the real things of bitcoin, many could find career here. Crypto is relatively new and may evolve into wonderful things than we could think in the future.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: I think the OP has a good initiative here by spreading awareness about opportunities and knowledge enhancement, business and career opportunities on bitcoin forum. I believe that from a financial point of view that this forum as well as crypto have helped people have a better financial situation and early adopters are no exception. I believe your initiative will more or less help them know about bitcoin or crypto in general, but of course you will not be held responsible for their ability to persist and understand it well.But unfortunately, the habit of the community that is formed because of the basic desire to make money will be the beginning that plunges them into various scams when they only care about money without much curiosity about knowledge. They just spamming this forum, they don't care about the quality of the posts and they start thinking that having more account will make them rich faster than forever depending on real work. This is the negative impression I've ever thought of from the crypto community out there especially when they make this forum a place to make money.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: JoyMarsha on August 16, 2022, 03:10:36 PMI started with the basics of crypto to lecture them, the forum ranks, merits, how to post and promote bounties, and the rules and regulations and so on. It is intimidating for many. Your initiative is good,  and one that is highly encouraged,  but I must correct you on something which I feel is very important. I feel that when ever we are educating our friends about crypto and presenting this forum to them as a place to learn more about bitcoin and crypto currencies,  we should always rule away the bounty part of it,  this is one of the reasons why we have so many spammers on the forum,  they register/sign up on this forum for bounty purposes alone, and not to contribute or learn anything meaningful on the forum. So I think it is high time we stop introducing bitcointalk to our friends as a forum where they can make money in bounties,  introduce the forum to them as place where they can learn about bitcoin ~ if they are new to cryptocurrencies and a place where they can share their crypto knowledge ~ if they are already into crypto currencies before.

comments.author: Piesel
comments.body: Alot need to be done in this direction, don't think is an easy job and if I must advise you I will say you should pay more attention to developing yourself and making yourself a role model, that is have a life in cryptocurrency that will serve as a motivation for them. I have tried to educate some forks around and have also made an attempt to get some of them registered on this forum, but what I discovered about most of them is that everyone thinks and takes Bitcoin as some get quick scheme and in that loses motivation when they're discovered that if you must make anything out of cryptocurrency then you have to invest some time and money into the learning process. And Bitcoin only rewards those that make an input and not free money grabbers.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: JoyMarsha on August 16, 2022, 03:10:36 PMGetting positive results of how eager they are willing to join and attain knowledge in crypto wasn't that easy because I started with the basics of crypto to lecture them, the forum ranks, merits, how to post and promote bounties, and the rules and regulations and so on. It is intimidating for many.Good initiative, but I do hope that you focused on what they can learn from bitcointalk and not on the ways to earn from it via bounties and signature campaigns because so many users got stuck in altcoin section doing bounties fro years, without ever realizing that bitcointalk is so much more than a cash cow. Don't get me wrong, its ok to mention that aspect of this forum as well as it will certainly attract some people (especially in developing countries) but it shouln't be a sole reason to register here.My only concern when it comes to success in attracting younger audience to bitcointalk is that for majority of them forum is too slow so they rather prefer Telegram/Twitter and other "faster" ways of communication.

comments.author: ShowOff
comments.body: Quote from: Rikafip on August 17, 2022, 09:02:51 AMGood initiative, but I do hope that you focused on what they can learn from bitcointalk and not on the ways to earn from it via bounties and signature campaigns because so many users got stuck in altcoin section doing bounties fro years, without ever realizing that bitcointalk is so much more than a cash cow.Well in the end it can't be prevented as long as the forum still has a bounty section. I understand that a lot of people here have taken forum as a side job that makes a few bucks to help them make ends meet. I wouldn't blame them for this but when they all end up in the wrong section then in the end they will never get any good knowledge other than just a few bucks off a non-potential altcoin.We've actually touched on this issue a few times where we sometimes give some advice so that beginners don't fall into the false expectations of many altcoin projects. Some beginners manage to develop their skills even they manage to have their own business by adopting bitcoin, but that's only a small percentage of people.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: JoyMarsha on August 16, 2022, 03:10:36 PMThe desire to help these young people navigate through a career path in the crypto sphere through this forum is my vision to accomplish. I want my friends and well-wishers to know about crypto.This forum is a good place to start learning about Bitcoin, cryptocurrency (alternate cryptocurrency) and some helpful supplementary such as security, privacy, etc.If one can learn and mature well in knowledge and skills from the forum, I am sure there will be lot of opened gates in crypto career. Just I hope nobody grows from this forum will turn to be a scammer. Building up yourself here and find jobs here or beyond it, but please don't use your reputation here to scam elsewhere.QuoteThat's why I came up with the plan to introduce and tell the youths about crypto, the forum and the rules and regulations governing it.The youths are future of the world and cryptocurrency world too. The Bitcoin demographics will become younger and younger with time and it will help the increasing adoption of Bitcoin and cryptocurrency.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: If you want to help these young people discover or develop their interest in crypto and build a career out of it, perhaps you might want to encourage them to take up computer science or IT courses. Many universities have already incorporated blockchain and crypto in general in their curricula. The knowledge that they could get from this forum would somehow prepare them or serve as foundation for their future career paths. But if what you refer to as "economic productivity" in this forum is by joining "bounties," I'm afraid you're not really helping them build "a career path in the crypto sphere."

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: OP, I saw through your good intention of wanting to help those around you know about Bitcoin and at the same time also achieve financial independence. However, let me give you heads on on this so you won't be taken aback. I suffered rejection from those I thought I was bringing the Bitcoin news to five years ago. In my excitement of the discovery of what Bitcoin was from my little knowledge, I approached those friends of mine to spread the good news. They wanted an instant show of result from my engagement in Bitcoin in terms of what I achieved financially since I was already in it. They didn't see any flashy stuff around me and so they didn't get interested because it wouldn't make them instant money. Fast forward, a few of those friends who rejected me are now coming back to it. I'm insisting on charging them a fee now if I must teach it to them. They lost it the first time when it was freely given, now they've to pay for it.

comments.author: Cryptomultiplier
comments.body: Quote from: Mpamaegbu on August 20, 2022, 05:04:29 AMThey lost it the first time when it was freely given, now they've to pay for it. I laughed after seeing this last quote because I have had a similar experience. Although I am the one in the first instance who didn't see the importance of this forum talk until much later when I had a job. my bill kept rising, but the person who introduced me to this forum encouraged me to persevere as I could learn and invest some cash so as to have an alternative to salary. Fast forwarding today, I have learnt more than I believe I could learn and have gotten to understand most terms I found confusing. Not only the youths should be taught about crypto, the children who can read and write should be taught as well. Crypto is the future of finance and commerce.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: You are doing a great job OP. Even though sharing some knowledge could lead also to rejection and non believers.  I am sharing too on my friends whom dont have knowledge with it and so far only some of them believes me until now.  Well they only get attentive when the hype on axie infinity roam around the globe.  Thats where they saw that cryptocurrency has a nice application to real world.  I am looking forward to blockchain dominance and how it can help us even more than simply a financial alternative without much restriction.

comments.author: CryptopreneurBrainboss
comments.body: Quote from: JoyMarsha on August 16, 2022, 03:10:36 PMGetting positive results of how eager they are willing to join and attain knowledge in crypto wasn't that easy because I started with the basics of crypto to lecture them, the forum ranks, merits, how to post and promote bounties, and the rules and regulations and so on. It is intimidating for many.Be careful so you won't be starting your own farm of bounty/signature hunters and spammers. Bringing people on to the forum with the hopes of financial education is a wrong way to go about teaching people. I understand that your aim might be pure but humans are known to misused privileges been given to them so there's no guarantee that those you're introducing onto the forum won't want to misused the privileges over here. For career path in crypto industry, if you truely want to succeed then you have to look beyond the forum as the opportunity here are limited. Signature and bounties participations should never been considered a career path. The best way to excel in the career aspect of this industry is by having a skills that you can sell as service for some cryptocurrency and I don't think the best paying ones are on the forum. The Forum is just a tools for learning about Bitcoin and hanging out with like minds.

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: OP took a very excellent initiative. I'm glad to see people introducing others to bitcoin and spreading awareness of it. It's encouraging to see that fresh graduates who haven't yet found stable employment are choosing the cryptocurrency market as a career route. In any case, it will help them meet their modest financial demands while they hunt for alternative sources of income, even if it is only as a side business. Not everyone who has the opportunity to learn about cryptocurrencies will do so. If they are not convinced and informed the genuine facts about it, some people may be given misleading information about it, which will reduce their interest in investing in it after learning about it. I hope they realize this and completely embrace cryptocurrency into their lives. Bringing them to this forum and teaching them the fundamentals here will be a driving tool to shift their interest into it.

comments.author: palle11
comments.body: You may have a good plan for your church members to learn about cryptocurrency and probably build a career in it either in blockchain, drafting or some other aspects which is good but I hope cryptocurrency is allowed in your country because if it is not you have already exposed yourself . Meanwhile this forum isn't particular about cryptocurrency but bitcoin. There are other forum where altcoins are main focus. These two threads will be helpfulTopic: Some important bitcointalk [GUIDE] for beginners.Topic: Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ.

comments.author: Cookdata
comments.body: Quote from: JoyMarsha on August 16, 2022, 03:10:36 PMWe hope by the end of it, the exposure to crypto and the Bitcoin forum will be magnificent. That many will find a career path in this field, as it presents a rare but available opportunity to advance into financial well-being.Crypto is wide, it presents plenty of opportunities and has become a home of job opportunities for many cryptographic programmers and developers and this forum is one the best place to start as a beginner, in fact, this forum is very friendly even though you have no knowledge about bitcoin, it naturally teaches you the basic and advances of bitcoin if you flow around the forum. It is important you should also know that this forum isn't just the knowledge alone you will benefit, the local boards have unite a lot of people from different backgrounds with common goals, they are all here because of bitcoin.
